gurmukhi: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਅੌਖੀ ਪਰ ਅਮੋਲਕ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਵਾਲਹੁ ਨਿਕੀ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਖੰਡੇ ਧਾਰਹੁ ਸੁਣੀਅੈ ਤਿਖੀ
transliteration: Vaalahu Nikee Aakheeai Khanday Dhaarahu Souneeai Tikhee.
translation: Sikh spirit is subtler than a trichome and sharper than the edge of sword.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਖਣਿ ਅਾਖਿ ਨ ਸਕੀਅੈ ਲੇਖ ਅਲੇਖ ਨ ਜਾੲੀ ਲਿਖੀ
transliteration: Aakhani Aakhi N Sakeeai Laykh Alaykh N Jaaee Likhee.
translation: Nothing can be said or explained about it and its indescribable account cannot be written.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥੁ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਅਪੜਿ ਨ ਸਕੈ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਵਿਖੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Vakhaaneeai Aparhi N Sakai Ikatu Vikhee.
translation: Defined as the way of the Gurmukhs, it cannot be attained by a single step.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਲ ਅਾਲੂਣੀ ਚਟਣੀ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਲਖ ਅਮਿਅ ਰਸ ੲਿਖੀ
transliteration: Sil Aaloonee Chatanee Tuli N Lakh Amia Ras Ikhee.
translation: It is like licking a tasteless stone but the joy of even the juice of millions of sweet sugar cane, cannot be compared with it.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਿਰਲੀ ਜੁ ਬਿਰਖੀ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiaa Bhaai Bhagati Viralee Ju Birakhee.
translation: The gurmukhs have attained the pleasure-fruit of loving devotion which grows on rare trees.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਤੁਠੈ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ
transliteration: Satigur Toutdai Paaeeai Saadhasangati Guramati Gurasikhee.
translation: By the grace of the true Guru, following the wisdom of the Guru and in the holy congregation alone the Sikh spirit is attained.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਭਿਖਕ ਭਿਖੀ ॥੧॥
transliteration: Chaari Padaarad Bhikhak Bhikhee ?1?
translation: Four ideals (dharma, arth, katm and rooks) of life are begged by the beggars.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਸਿਖੀ ਨਿਸ਼ਕਾਮ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh life is without desires

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਅਾਖੀਅਨਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੇੲਿ ਨ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਮੰਗੈ
transliteration: Chaari Padaarad Aakheeani Satigur Dayi N Gurasikhu Mangai.
translation: The true Guru himself bestows the four ideals; the Sikh of the Guru does a ask for them.

gurmukhi: ਅਠ ਸਿਧੀ ਨਿਧੀ ਨਵੈ ਰਿਧਿ ਨ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੁ ਢਾਕੈ ਟੰਗੈ
transliteration: Atd Sidhi Nidhee Navai Ridhi N Guru Sikhu Ddhaakai Tangai.
translation: The gurmukh never carries on his back the nine treasures and eight miraculous powers.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਧੇਣੁ ਲਖ ਲਖਮੀ ਪਹੁੰਚ ਨ ਹੰਘੈ ਢੰਗਿ ਸੁਢੰਗੈ
transliteration: Kaamadhaynu Lakh Lakhamee Pahounch N Hanghai Ddhangi Suddhangai.
translation: Wish fulfilling cow and millions of Laksamis, 'With their fine gestures cannot reach a gursikh — Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਪਾਰਸ ਲਖ ਪਾਰਜਾਤ ਹਥਿ ਨ ਛੁਹਦਾ ਫਲ ਨ ਅਭੰਗੈ
transliteration: Lakh Paaras Lakh Paarijaat Hadi N Chhuhadaa Phal N Abhangai.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru never touches the philosopher's stone or transitory fruits millions of wishfulfilling trees.

gurmukhi: ਤੰਤ ਮੰਤ ਪਾਖੰਡ ਲਖ ਬਾਜੀਗਰ ਬਾਜਾਰੀ ਨੰਗੈ
transliteration: Tant Mant Paakhand Lakh Baajeegar Baajaaree Nagai.
translation: Millions of tantrists knowing mantras and tantras are mere naked acrobats for a Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦੀ ਗਾਖੜੀ ੲਿਕਸ ਅੰਗਿ ਨ ਅੰਗਣਿ ਅੰਗੈ
transliteration: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Ikas Angi N Angani Angai.
translation: The Guru­ disciple relationship is very complex because many are its laws and byelaws.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੁ ਦੂਜੇ ਭਾਵਹੁ ਸੰਗੈ ॥੨॥
transliteration: Gurasikhu Doojay Bhaavahu Sangai ?2?
translation: The Sikh of the Guru is ever shy of the sense of duality.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਸਿਖੀ ਦੀ ਅਮੋਲਕਤਾ
translation: Invaluableness of Sikh life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਖਣਾ ਨਾਦੁ ਨ ਵੇਦ ਨ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Naadu N Vayd N Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: The discipline of the discipleship of the Guru is ineffable for the Vedas and all the melodies.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਲਿਖਣਾ ਲਖ ਨ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਗੁਪਤਿ ਲਿਖਿ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Lakh N Chitr Goupati Likhi Jaanai.
translation: Even Chitragupt, the writer of the accounts of the actions of the people, does not know how to write about the spirit of Sikh life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਮਰਣੋ ਸੇਖ ਅਸੰਖ ਨ ਰੇਖ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Simaranon Saykh Asankh N Raykh Siaanai.
translation: The glory of simaran, remembrance of the name of the Lord, cannot be known by myriad Seanags (thousand hooded mythical snake).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਵਰਤਮਾਨੁ ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਪਛਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Varatamaanu Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Pachhaanai.
translation: The conduct of the Sikh spirit can be known only by going beyond the worldly phenomena.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਬੁਝਣਾ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਿਵ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Bujhanaa Giaan Dhiaan Andari Kiv Aanai.
translation: How can anybody understand the Sikh way of life or Gursikhi through learning and contemplation alone?

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਪਰਸਾਦੀ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਾਣੁ ਨਿਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Parasaadi Saadhasangi Sabad Surati Hoi Maanu Nimaanai.
translation: By the grace of the Guru, in the holy congregation, the gursikh concentrating his consciousness in the Word sheds pride and becomes humble.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਰੰਗੁ ਮਾਣੈ ॥੩॥
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Viralaa Rangu Maanai ?3?
translation: A rare one may enjoy the pleasure of loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦੀ ਸਿੱਖ੍ਰਯਾ ਤੇ ਰਸ
translation: Joy and teachings of the Sikh life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਖਣਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਦੀ ਸੇਵਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Dee Sayvaa.
translation: The way of learning the conduct of a Sikh of the Guru is that one should be the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਨ ਸਿਖਿਅਾ ਗੀਤਾ ਗੋਸਟਿ ਅਲਖ ਅਭੇਵਾ
transliteration: Das Avataar N Sikhiaa Geetaa Gosati Alakh Abhayvaa.
translation: This mystery was not known even to the ten incarnations (of Visrnu); this mystery is beyond the Gita and discussions.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਨ ਜਾਣਨ ਭੇਦ ਕਿਹੁ ਲਿਖਿ ਪੜਿ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਣੁ ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵਾ
transliteration: Vayd N Jaanan Bhayd Kihu Likhi Parhi Souni Sanu Dayvee Dayvaa.
translation: Then the Vedas know not its secret though they are studied by gods and godesses.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਨ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਤੰਤ ਨ ਮੰਤ ਲੰਘਾੲਿਨਿ ਖੇਵਾ
transliteration: Sidh Naad N Samaadhi Vichi Tant N Mant Laghaaini Khayvaa.
translation: The deep meditations of the siddhs, naths and even the tantta­tras could not cross the teachings and practices of Sikh way of life.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਭਗਤਿ ਜਗਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਿਖਿ ਨ ਗੲੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਟੇਵਾ
transliteration: Lakh Bhagati Jagat Vichi Likhi N Gaay Guru Sikhee Tayvaa.
translation: Millions of devotees flourished in this World but they also could not understand the life-discipline of the Sikhs of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਲਾ ਅਲੂਣੀ ਚਟਣੀ ਸਾਦਿ ਨ ਪੁਜੈ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਮੇਵਾ
transliteration: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Saadi N Pujai Lakh Lakh Mayvaa.
translation: This life is similar the licking of the saltless stone but its taste is incomparable even to the millions of fruits.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸਮੇਵਾ ॥੪॥
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Samayvaa ?4?
translation: Absorption in the word of the Guru in the holy congregation is the accomplishment of the life of a gursikh.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦੀ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰ
translation: Practices for attainment of Sikh-life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਖਣਾ ਸਬਦਿ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਤਿਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਿਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Sabadi Surati Satisangati Sikhai.
translation: To learn about Sikh-life, one ought to merge one's consciousness in the Word in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਲਿਖਣਾ ਗੁਰ ਬਾਣੀ ਸੁਣਿ ਸਮਝੈ ਲਿਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Gurabaanee Souni Samajhai Likhai.
translation: Writing about Sikh life is to go on listening, understanding and continuously writing.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਮਰਣੋ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਮੰਤੁ ਕੋਲੂ ਰਸੁ ੲਿਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Simarano Satiguru Mantu Koloo Rasu Ikhai.
translation: Simran, meditation in Sikh life is learning the Guru-mantra (Vahiguru) which is sweet like sugarcane juice.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਵਰਤਮਾਨੁ ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਬਿਰਿਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Varatamaanu Chandan Vaasu Nivaasu Birikhai.
translation: The spirit of the Sikhism is like fragrance residing in sandalwood trees.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਬੁਝਣਾ ਬੁਝਿ ਅਬੁਝਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਲੈ ਭਿਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Bujhanaa Bujhi Abujhi Hovai Lai Bhikhai.
translation: The understanding of a Sikh of the Guru consists in the fact that even after having received the gifted alms (of nom) and being fully knowledgeable, he considered himself as ignorant.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਸਰਿਖੈ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Sarikhai.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru, in the holy congregation listens to the word of the Guru and practises meditation, charity and ablution,

gurmukhi: ਵਰਤਮਾਨੁ ਲੰਘਿ ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖੈ ॥੫॥
transliteration: Varatamaanu Laghi Bhoot Bhavikhai ?5?
translation: And thus goes across the past present to a new the future.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤੀ ਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਕਾਰ
translation: Conduct of the Sikh life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਬੋਲਣਾ ਹੁੲਿ ਮਿਠ ਬੋਲਾ ਲਿਖੈ ਨ ਲੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Bolanaa Hui Mitd Bolaa Likhai N Laykhai.
translation: The Sikh life one speaks mildly and never gets oneself noticed i.e. ego is diated.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਚਲਣਾ ਚਲੈ ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਲੀਤੇ ਭੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Chalanaa Chalai Bhai Vichi Leetay Bhaykhai.
translation: Maintaining the Sikh form and moving in the fear of the Lord constitute the Sikh way of living.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਰਾਹੁ ੲੇਹੁ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਚਾਲ ਚਲੈ ਸੋ ਦੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Raahu Ayhu Guramoukhi Chaal Chalai So Daykhai.
translation: Sikh living means following the footsteps gursikhs.

gurmukhi: ਘਾਲਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਸੇਵਾ ਕਰੈ ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਵੇਸੁ ਵਿਸੇਖੈ
transliteration: Ghaali Khaai Sayvaa Karai Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Visaykhai.
translation: One should eat the fruit of one's own labour, do service and could always remain inspired by the teachings of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਪੜੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਰੂਪ ਨ ਰੇਖੈ
transliteration: Aapu Ganaai N Aparhai Aapu Gavaaay Roop N Raykhai.
translation: The supreme rd is not attained through egotism and only after losing the sense of ego e can identify oneself with the formless and limitless Lord.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦੇ ਵਾਂਗੁ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰ ਗੋਰੀ ਵੜਿ ਅਲਖ ਅਲੇਖੈ
transliteration: Muraday Vaang Mureed Hoi Gur Goree Varhi Alakh Alaykhai.
translation: A disciple coming like a dead person and entering into the guru-grave can merge in at imperceptible Lord who is beyond all writs.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਮੰਤੁ ਨ ਸੇਖ ਸਰੇਖੈ ॥੬॥
transliteration: Antu N Mantu N Saykh Saraykhai ?6?
translation: Sesanags could not derstand the mystery of His mantra.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦੀ ਅਮੋਲਕਤਾ
translation: Invalnability of Sikh life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਿਖਣਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸਿਖਣ ਬਜਰੁ ਭਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Guru Sikh Sikhan Bajaru Bhaaraa.
translation: Learning of the Sikh way of life is as tough as the thunderbolt and only the Sikhs of the Guru learn it.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਲਿਖਣਾ ਲੇਖੁ ਅਲੇਖੁ ਨ ਲਿਖਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Laykhu Alaykhu N Likhanahaaraa.
translation: Writing about the Sikh-life is also beyond all accounts; none can write.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਤੋਲਣਾ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਤੋਲਿ ਤੁਲੈ ਤੁਲ ਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Tolanaa Tuli N Toli Tulai Tuladhaaraa.
translation: No scale can weigh the Sikh way of life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਦੇਖਣਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਦੁਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Daykhanaa Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Guraduaaraa.
translation: The glimpse of the Sikh life can be had only in the holy congregation and the Gurdvara, the door of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਚਖਣਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਵੀਚਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Chakhanaa Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Veechaaraa.
translation: Pondering upon the word of Guru in the holy congregation is like tasting of the Sikh way of life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸਮਝਣਾ ਜੋਤੀ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਾਵਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Samajhanaa Jotee Joti Jagaavanahaaraa.
translation: Understanding of the Sikh life is like kindling the flame of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮੁ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piramu Piaaraa ?7?
translation: The pleasure-fruit of the Gurmukhs is the love of the dear Lord.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਸਿੱਧੀ ਪਾਕੇ ੳੁੱਚੇ ਹੋੲੀਦਾ ਹੈ
translation: One becomes truthful after attaining the Sikh-life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਰੂਪ ਦੇਖਿ ੲਿਕਸ ਬਾਝੁ ਨ ਹੋਰਸੁ ਦੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Roop Daykhi Ikas Baajhu N Horasu Daykhai.
translation: One who has attained Sikh-life does not wish to have glimpse of any (god, goddess) except the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਚਖਣਾ ਲਖ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਫਲ ਫਿਕੈ ਲੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Chakhanaa Lakh Anmrit Phal Dhikai Laykhai.
translation: To one who has tasted the Sikh-life, million of ambrosial fruits taste mawkish.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਨਾਦੁ ਸੁਣਿ ਲਖ ਅਨਹਦ ਵਿਸਮਾਦ ਅਲੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Naadu Souni Lakh Anahad Visamaad Alaykhai.
translation: Listening to the melody of Sikh-life, one enjoys the wondrous delight of millions of unstruck melodies.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਪਰਸਣਾ ਠੰਢਾ ਤਤਾ ਭੇਖ ਅਭੇਖੈ
transliteration: Guroo Sikhee Daa Parasanaa Tdaddhaa Tataa Bhaykh Abhaykhai.
translation: Those who have come in touch with the Sikh spirit have gone beyond the impacts of :hot and cold, guise and disguise.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦੀ ਵਾਸੁ ਲੈ ਹੁੲਿ ਦੁਰਗੰਧ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਸਰੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Vaasu Lai Hui Duragandh Sougandh Saraykhai.
translation: Having inhaled the fragrance of Sikh life, one feels all other fragrances as a smell.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਮਰ ਜੀਵਣਾ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਨਿਮਖ ਨਿਮੇਖੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Mar Jeevanaa Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Nimakh Namaykhai.
translation: One who has started living the ,Sikh way of life, lives every moment in loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ਅਲੇਪ ਰਹੈ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦਿ ਵਿਸੇਖੈ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Alapi Rahai Gur Sabadi Visaykhai ?8?
translation: Subsumed in the 'word of Guru, he remains detached from the world.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦਾ ਕਰਤੱਬ
translation: Activity in the Sikh-life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਚਾ ਪੰਥੁ ਹੈ ਸਿਖੁ ਸਹਜ ਘਰਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਖਲੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sachaa Pandu Hai Sikhu Sahaj Ghari Jaai Khalovai.
translation: The way of gurmukhs is that way of truth treading which, the Sikh automatically stabilizes in his innate nature.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਚੁ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਹੈ ਪੈਰੀਂ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕੁ ਜੁ ਹੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sachu Raharaasi Hai Paireen Pai Paa Khaaku Ju Hovai.
translation: The conduct of gurmukhs is true; touching of the feet and becoming of dust of the feet i.e. getting most humble is their active behaviour.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਨਾਵਣਾ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਲੈ ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਮਲੁ ਧੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Daa Naavanaa Guramati Lai Duramati Malu Dhovai.
translation: The ablution in Sikh-life is washing away of evil propensities by adopting the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਪੂਜਣਾ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪੂਜ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਭੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Daa Poojanaa Gurasikh Pooj Piram Rasu Bhovai.
translation: Worship in Sikh-life is the worship (service) to the Sikhs of the Guru and getting drenched in the shower of love of the dear Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਮੰਨਣਾ ਗੁਰ ਬਚਨੀ ਗਲਿ ਹਾਰੁ ਪਰੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Daa Mannanaa Gur Bachanee Gali Haaru Parovai.
translation: Wearing the words of the Guru like garland, is the accepting of the will of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਜੀਵਣਾ ਜੀਵਦਿਅਾਂ ਮਰਿ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਖੋਵੈ
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Daa Jeevanaa Jeenvadiaan Mari Haoumai Khovai.
translation: Life of a gursikh is being dead i.e. losing one's ego while alive.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਵਿਲੋਵੈ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Vilovai ?9?
translation: In such a life the word of the Guru is churned in the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਦੀ ਕਾਰ
translation: Performance of Sikh life

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਖਾਵਣਾ ਦੁਖੁ ਸੁਖੁ ਸਮ ਕਰਿ ਅੳੁਚਰ ਚਰਣਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Khaavanaa Doukhu Soukhu Samakari Aouchar Charanaa.
translation: Adopting pleasure and pain equally, the gurmukhs eat the fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਗਾਵਣਾ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਬਾਣੀ ਨਿਝਰੁ ਝਰਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Gaavanaa Anmrit Baanee Nijharu Jharanaa.
translation: Music in the Sikh way of life is the continuous flow (singing) of ambrosial hymns of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਧੀਰਜੁ ਧਰਮੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Dheeraju Dharamu Piram Piaalaa Ajaru Jaranaa.
translation: Fortitude and duty in Sikh life is the bearing of the unbearable power of the cup of love.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਸੰਜਮੋ ਡਰਿ ਨਿਡਰੁ ਨਿਡਰਿ ਮੁਚ ਡਰਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Sanjamo Dari Nidaru Nidar Mouch Daranaa.
translation: The practice of continence in Sikhism is getting fearless in this scaring world and moving always in the fear of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਜਗੁ ਦੁਤਰੁ ਤਰਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Mili Saadhasangi Sabad Surati Jagu Doutaru Taranaa.
translation: Another doctrine of the Sikh life is that joining the holy congregation and concentrating the mind in the word, man goes across the world ocean.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦਾ ਕਰਮੁ ੲੇਹੁ ਗੁਰ ਫੁਰਮਾੲੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਕਰਣਾ
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Daa Karamu Ayhu Gur Phuramaaay Gurasikh Karanaa.
translation: Acting according the instructions of the Guru is the performance of the Sikh life.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਰਣਾ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Gur Kirapaa Guru Sikhu Guru Saranaa ?10?
translation: By the grace of the Guru, the disciple (Sikh) remains in the shelter of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਗੁਰੂ ਦੀ ਸ਼ਕਤੀ ਤੇ ਗੁਣ
translation: Powers and virtues of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਵਾਸਿ ਸੁਵਾਸੁ ਨਿਵਾਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਸਿੰਮਲਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Vaasi Suvaasu Nivaasu Kari Sinmali Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Laaay.
translation: Diffusing in all the places like fragrance, the gurmukh makes even the mind oriented, manmukh, fragrant by giving him pleasure-fruit.

gurmukhi: ਸੋੲਿਨਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਨੂਰੁ ਮਿਲੁ ਕਾਗਹੁ ਪਰਮ ਹੰਸੁ ਕਰਵਾੲੇ
transliteration: Paaras Hoi Manooru Malu Kaagahu Param Hansu Karavaaay.
translation: He transforms iron slag into gold and the crows into the swans of highest order (param hails).

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤਹੁ ਦੇਵ ਕਰਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੇਵ ਸੇਵ ਭੈ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Kari Satigur Dayv Sayv Bhai Paaay.
translation: Consequent to the service of the true Guru, animals and ghosts also become gods.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਨਿਧਾਨ ਰਖਿ ਸੰਖ ਵਿਚਿ ਹਰਿ ਜੀ ਲੈ ਲੈ ਹਥਿ ਵਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sabh Nidhaan Rakhi Sankh Vichi Hari Jee Lai Lai Hadi Vajaaay.
translation: Having all the treasures in His hand (conch) He goes on distributing them with his hand among the people day and night.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਛਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Aakheeai Bhagati Vachhal Hoi Aapu Chhalaaay.
translation: Called as the redeemer of the sinners, the Lord, loving to the devotees, gets Himself deluded by the devotees.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਗੁਣ ਕਰੇ ਜਗੁ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਗੁਣ ਗੁਰ ਭਾੲੇ
transliteration: Goun Keetay Goun Karay Jag Avagoun Keetay Goun Gur Bhaaay.
translation: The whole world is good towards the wellwisher alone, but, the Guru loves to do good even to the evil doer.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਜਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਾੲੇ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Jag Vichi Aaay ?11?
translation: Guru has come to the world as a benevolent entity.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਸਿੱਖ ਪ੍ਰ੍ਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ
translation: Sikh, the altruist

gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਦੇ ਵਟ ਵਗਾੲਿਅਾ ਤਛਣਹਾਰੈ ਤਾਰਿ ਤਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Phal Day Vat Vagaaiaan Tachhanahaaray Taari Tarandaa.
translation: A tree gives fruits to stone thrower and wooden boat to the cutter to get him across.

gurmukhi: ਤਛੇ ਪੁਤ ਨ ਡੋਬੲੀ ਪੁਤ ਵੈਰੁ ਜਲ ਜੀ ਨ ਧਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Tachhay Pout N Dobaee Pout Vairu Jal Jee N Dharandaa.
translation: Water, the father (of tree) not remembering the evil deeds (of carpenter) does not drown the boat along with carpenter.

gurmukhi: ਵਰਸੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਹੰਸ ਧਾਰ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਿਲ ਜਲੁ ਨੀਵਾਣਿ ਚਲੰਦਾ
transliteration: Varasai Hoi Sahans Dhaar Mili Gil Jalu Neevaani Chaladaa.
translation: Becoming thousands of currents when it rains, water in thousand streams flows towards the lower places.

gurmukhi: ਡੋਬੈ ਡਬੈ ਅਗਰ ਨੋ ਅਾਪੁ ਛਡਿ ਪੁਤ ਪੈਜ ਰਖੰਦਾ
transliteration: Dobai Dabai Agar No Aapu Chhadi Pout Paij Rakhandaa.
translation: Wood of agar tree is drowned but repudiating ego, water saves the honour of its son, wood of the tree [in fact agar(eaglewood) floats under water surface].

gurmukhi: ਤਰਿ ਡੁਬੈ ਡੁਬਾ ਤਰੈ ਜਿਣਿ ਹਾਰੈ ਹਾਰੈ ਸੁ ਜਿਣੰਦਾ
transliteration: Tari Doubai Doubaa Tarai Jini Haarai Haarai Su Jinandaa.
translation: He who goes on swimming upon the water (of love) may be understood as drowned and he who drowns in love, may be considered as having swum across.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲਟਾ ਖੇਲੁ ਪਿਰੰਮ ਦਾ ਪੈਰਾਂ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਸੀਸੁ ਨਿਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Ulataa Khaylu Piranm Daa Pairaan Oupari Seesu Nivandaa.
translation: Similarly, winner in the world loses and becoming detached and the loser, one wins (ultimately).

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪਹੁ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ ਮੰਦਾ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Aapahu Kisai N Jaanai Mandaa ?12?
translation: Inverse is the tradition of love which makes the head bow to the feet. The altruist Sikh considers none as the bad or the worse.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਸਿੱਖ ਨਿੰਮ੍ਰ ਤੇ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪ੍ਰਤਾਪੀਅਾਂ ਚਿਰਜੀਵੀਅਾਂ ਤੋਂ ੳੁੱਚਾ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਵਿਚ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਪੈਰਾ ਹੇਠਿ ਹੈ ਧਰਤੀ ਹੇਠਿ ਵਸੰਦਾ ਪਾਣੀ
transliteration: Dharatee Pairaan Haytdi Hai Dharatee Haytdi Vasandaa Paanee.
translation: The earth is under our feet but under the earth is water.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਚਲੈ ਨੀਵਾਣ ਨੋ ਨਿਰਮਲੁ ਸੀਤਲੁ ਸੁਧੁ ਪਰਾਣੀ
transliteration: Paanee Chalai Neevaanu No Niramalu Seetalu Sudhu Paraanee.
translation: Water flows downward and makes others cool and clean.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਰੰਗੀ ੲਿਕ ਰੰਗੁ ਹੈ ਸਭਨਾ ਅੰਦਰਿ ੲਿਕੋ ਜਾਣੀ
transliteration: Bahu Rangee Ik Rangu Hai Sabhanaan Andari Iko Jaanee.
translation: Mixed with various colours it assumes those colours but in itself it is colourless common to all.

gurmukhi: ਤਤਾ ਹੋਵੈ ਧੁਪ ਵਿਚਿ ਛਾਵੈ ਠੰਢਾ ਵਿਰਤੀ ਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Tataa Hovai Dhoup Vichi Chhaavai Tdaddhaa Viratee Haanee.
translation: It becomes hot in the sun and cool in the shade, that is it acts in consonance with its companions (sun and shade).

gurmukhi: ਤਪਦਾ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਨੋ ਠੰਢੇ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਵਿਹਾਣੀ
transliteration: Tapadaa Paraoupakaar No Tdaddhay Paraoupakaar Vihaanee.
translation: Whethger hot or cold its purpose always is other's good.

gurmukhi: ਅਗਨਿ ਬੁਝਾੲੇ ਤਪਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਠੰਢਾ ਹੋਵੈ ਬਿਲਮੁ ਨ ਅਾਣੀ
transliteration: Agani Bujhaaay Tapati Vichi Tdaddhaa Hovai Bilamu N Aanee.
translation: Though itself warm it extinguishes the fire and takes no time to get cold again.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਦੀ ੲੇਹ ਨੀਸਾਣੀ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Dee Ayhu Neesaanee ?13?
translation: These are the virtuous marks of the Sikh culture.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਸਿਖ ਨਿੰਮ੍ਰੀ ਤੇ ਪਰੋਪਕਾਰੀ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਧਰਤਿ ਹੈ ਧਰਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਾਣੀ ਵਸੈ
transliteration: Paanee Andari Dharati Hai Dharatee Andari Paanee Vasai.
translation: Earth is in water and in the earth also is water.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਰੰਗੁ ਨ ਰੰਗ ਸਭ ਧਰਤੀ ਸਾੳੁ ਨ ਸਭ ਰਸ ਰਸੈ
transliteration: Dharatee Rangu N Rang Sabh Dharatee Saau N Sabh Ras Rasai.
translation: Earth has no colour yet it has all colours (in the form of different vegetation) in it.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਗੰਧੁ ਨ ਗੰਧ ਬਹੁ ਧਰਤਿ ਨ ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪ ਤਰਸੈ
transliteration: Dharatee Gandhu N Gandh Bahu Dharati N Roop Anoop Tarasai.
translation: Earth has no taste yet all the tastes are contained in it.

gurmukhi: ਜੇਹਾ ਬੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਲੁਣੈ ਕਰਮਿ ਭੂਮਿ ਸਭ ਕੋੲੀ ਦਸੈ
transliteration: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Karami Bhoomi Sabh Koee Dasai.
translation: No smell is there in the earth, yet all the fragrances reside in it.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਲੇਪੁ ਨ ਲੇਪੁ ਹੈ ਕਰਿ ਮਲ ਮੂਤ ਕਸੂਤੁ ਨ ਧਸੈ
transliteration: Chandan Laypu N Laypu Hai Kari Mal Moot Kasootu N Dhasai.
translation: Earth is a field for actions; here one reaps what one sows.

gurmukhi: ਵੁਠੇ ਮੀਹ ਜਮਾੲਿਦੇ ਡਵਿ ਲਗੈ ਅੰਗੂਰੁ ਵਿਗਸੈ
transliteration: Voutday Meeh Jamaaiday Davi Lagai Angooru Vigasai.
translation: Plastered with sandal paste, it does not get attached to it and fouled up by creatures' excreta it does not sink with anger and shame.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖਿ ਨ ਰੋਵੈ ਸੁਖਿ ਨ ਹਸੈ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Doukhi N Rovai Soukhi N Hasai ?14?
translation: After rains people sow corn in it and even after (getting heat) fire new seedlings sprout from it. It does not wail in suffering nor laughs in pleasure.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਸਿੱਖ ਦੀ ਨਿੱਤ ਕਮਾੲੀ
translation: Daily conduct of the Sikh

gurmukhi: ਪਿਛਲ ਰਾਤੀ ਜਾਗਣਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਦਾਨੁ ੲਿਸਨਾਨੁ ਦਿੜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Pichhal Raateen Jaaganaa Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhaaay.
translation: The Sikh awakes in the pre-dawn hour and meditating upon Nan, he becomes alert for ablution and charity.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਨਿਵ ਚਲਣੁ ਹਥਹੁ ਦੇ ਕੈ ਭਲਾ ਮਨਾੲੇ
transliteration: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Hadahu Day Kai Bhalaa Manaaay.
translation: He speaks sweetly, moves humbly and giving away something by his hands for the well being of others feels happy.

gurmukhi: ਥੋੜਾ ਸਵਣਾ ਖਾਵਣਾ ਥੋੜਾ ਬੋਲਨੁ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dorhaa Savanaa Khaavanaa Dorhaa Bolanu Guramati Paaay.
translation: Sleeping and eating maderately he, according to the teachings of the Guru, also does not speak much.

gurmukhi: ਘਾਲਿ ਖਾੲਿ ਸੁਕ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਕਰੈ ਵਡਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Ghaali Khaai Soukritu Karai Vadaa Hoi N Aapu Ganaaay.
translation: He toils to earn, performs good deeds and though being great never gets his greatness noticed.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਾਂਵਦੇ ਰਾਤਿ ਦਿਹੈਂ ਨਿਤ ਚਲਿ ਚਲਿ ਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Gaanvaday Raati Dihain Nit Chali Chali Jaaay.
translation: Walking for day and night he reaches where Gurbant is sung in the congregation.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਪਰਚਾ ਕਰੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪਰਚੈ ਮਨ ਪਰਚਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Parachaa Karai Satiguru Parachai Manu Parachaaay.
translation: He keeps his consciousness merged in the Word and maintains in the mind love for the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਰਾਸੁ ਵਲਾੲੇ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay ?15?
translation: Amid hopes and desires, he remains detached.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਸਿਖ ਦੀ ਨਿੱਤ ਕਮਾੲੀ
translation: Daily conduct of the Sikh

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖੁ ਸਦਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Guru Sikh Souni Gurasikhu Sadaavai.
translation: Having listened to the teachings of the Guru the disciple and the Guru become one (in form and spirit).

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਅਰਾਧਣਾ ਬਾਹਰਿ ਜਾਂਦਾ ਵਰਜਿ ਰਹਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ik Mani Iku Araadhanaa Baahari Jaandaa Varaji Rahaavai.
translation: He with single mind adores the one Lord and keeps his straying mind under control.

gurmukhi: ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਖਸਮੈ ਦਾ ਭਾਣਾ ਤਿਸੁ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Houkamee Bandaa Hoi Kai Khasamai Daa Bhaanaa Tisu Bhaavai.
translation: He becomes obedient servant of the lord and loves His will and command.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਸੋੲਿ ਕੋ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਗੁਰਿ ਗੋਰਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Muradaa Hoi Mureed Soi Ko Viralaa Guri Gori Samaavai.
translation: Any rare Sikh becoming disciple be a dead person enters the guru-grave.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੈਰਾਂ ੳੁਪਰਿ ਸੀਸੁ ਧਰਾਵੈ
transliteration: Pairee Pai Paakhaaku Hoi Pairaan Oupari Seesu Dharaavai.
translation: Falling on the feet and becoming dust of the feet, he reposes his head on the feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲੇ ਅਾਪੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਨ ਨਦਰੀ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Aapu Gavaaay Aapu Hoi Doojaa Bhaau N Nadaree Aavai.
translation: Becoming one with Him he loses his ego and now the sense of duality is nowhere visible with him.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਗੁਰੁਸਿਖ ਕਮਾਵੈ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Guru Sikhee Guru Sikhu Kamaavai ?16?
translation: Such an accomplishment is had only by Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸਿੱਖ
translation: Rare Sikh

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਦਰਸਨ ਜੋਤਿ ਪਤੰਗ ਮਿਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Darasan Joti Patang Miladay.
translation: Rare are those people who like a moth rush toward the flame of the glimpse (of the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਿਰਗ ਮਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Sabad Surati Hoi Mirag Maranday.
translation: They are also rare in the world who merging their consciousness in the Word die like a deer.

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਹੁੲਿ ਭਵਰ ਵਸੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Charan Kaval Hui Bhavar Vasanday.
translation: Rare are they in this world who like black bee adore lotus feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਿਰਮ ਸਨੇਹੀ ਮੀਨ ਤਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Piram Sanayhee Meen Taranday.
translation: Rare are (the Sikhs) in the world who becoming full of love swim like fish.

gurmukhi: ਤੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਸੈਂਸਾਰ ਵਿਚਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Guru Sikh Guru Sikh Sayv Karanday.
translation: Such Sikhs of the Guru are also rare who serve other Sikhs of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਜੰਮਨਿ ਭੈ ਰਹਨਿ ਭੈ ਵਿਚਿ ਮਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਜੀਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bhai Vichi Janmani Bhai Rahani Bhai Vichi Mari Guru Sikh Jeevanday.
translation: Taking birth and sustaining in His order (fear), the Sikhs of the Guru who die while alive (are also rare).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮੁ ਚਖੰਦੇ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Guramoukh Soukh Phalu Piramu Chakhanday ?17?
translation: Thus becoming gurmukhs they taste the fruit of joy.

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਸਰਬ ਸ਼ਿਰੋਮਣੀ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh life is supreme

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਜਪ ਤਪ ਲਖ ਸੰਜਮਾ ਹੋਮ ਜਗ ਲਖ ਵਰਤ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Lakh Jap Tap Lakh Sanjamaan Hom Jag Lakh Varat Karanday.
translation: Millions of recitations, disciplines, continences, burnt oblations and fasts are performed.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਤੀਰਥ ਲਖ ੳੂਲਖਾ ਲਖ ਪੁਰੀਅਾ ਲਖ ਪੁਰਬ ਲਗੰਦੇ
transliteration: Lakh Teerad Lakh Oolakhaa Lakh Pureeaa Lakh Purab Laganday.
translation: Millions of holy journeys, charities are undertaken and millions of holy occasions are celebrated.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵਲ ਦੇਹੁਰੇ ਲਖ ਪੁਜਾਰੀ ਪੂਜ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayval Dayhuray Lakh Pujaaree Pooj Karanday.
translation: In the abodes of goddesses, and the temples, millions of priests perform worship.

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਥਲ ਮਹੀਅਲ ਭਰਮਦੇ ਕਰਮ ਧਰਮ ਲਖ ਫੇਰਿ ਫਿਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Jal Dal Maheeal Bharamaday Karam Dharam Lakh Dhayri Dhiranday.
translation: Moving on earth and in the sky, millions practitioners of dharma-oriented activities run hither and thither.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਪਰਬਤ ਵਣਖੰਡ ਲਖ ਲਖ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Lakh Parabat Van Khand Lakh Lakh Udaasee Hoi Bhavanday.
translation: Millions of people becoming unconcerned with worldy affairs go on moving in the mountains and forests.

gurmukhi: ਅਗਨੀ ਅੰਗੁ ਜਲਾੲਿਂਦੇ ਲਖ ਹਿਮੰਚਲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਗਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Aganee Angu Jalaainday Lakh Himanchali Jaai Galaday.
translation: Millions are there who die by burning themselves and millions are there who die by freezing themselves In the snowy mountains.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖੀ ਸੁਖੁ ਤਿਲੁ ਨ ਲਹੰਦੇ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Gur Sikhee Soukhu Tilu N Lahanday ?18?
translation: But they all cannot take even a fraction of joy ,Attainable in the life of a Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਪੂਰਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਬਿਨ ਗਤਿ ਨਹੀਂ
translation: No liberation without the perfect Guru  ''

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਣ ਕਰਿ ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਵਰਨੁ ਚਿਹਨੁ ਕਿਹੁ ਨਦਰਿ ਨ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Kari Varatiaa Varanu Chihanu Kihu Nadari N Aaiaa.
translation: That Lord is diffused in all the four varnas, but , His own colour and mark are imperceptible.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਭੇਖਧਾਰੀਅਾਂ ਦਰਸਨ ਵਿਚਿ ਨ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Chhia Darasanu Bhaykhadhaareeaan Darasan Vichi N Darasanu Paaiaa.
translation: The followers of the six philosophical orders (of India) could not see Him in their philosophies.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਨਿਅਾਸੀ ਦਸ ਨਾਵ ਧਰਿ ਨਾੳੁ ਗਣਾੲਿ ਨ ਨਾੳੁ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sanniaasee Das Naav Dhari Naau Ganaai N Naau Dhiaaiaa.
translation: Sannyasis giving ten names to their sects, counted His many names but donnot contemplate the Nam.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਵਲ ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਪੰਥੁ ਨ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Raaval Baarah Pand Kari Guramoukh Pandu N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.
translation: Ravals (yogis) made their twelve sects but the imperceptible way of the gurmukhs could not be known by them.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁ ਰੂਪੀ ਬਹੁ ਰੂਪੀੲੇ ਰੂਪ ਨ ਰੇਖ ਨ ਲੇਖੁ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bahu Roopee Bahu Roopeeay Roop N Raykh N Laykhu Mitaaiaa.
translation: The mimics assumed many forms but even then they could not wipe out the writ (inscribed by the Lord) i.e. they could not attain liberation from transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਚਲਦੇ ਸੰਗ ਲਖ ਸਾਧੂ ਸੰਗਿ ਨ ਰੰਗ ਰੰਗਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Mili Mili Chaladay Sang Lakh Saadhoo Sangi N Rang Rangaaiaa.
translation: Though millions of people move jointly creating various leagues and sects but they also could not dye their minds in the (steadfast) colour of holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਣ ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰੇ ਮੋਹੇ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Vin Guru Pooray Mohay Maaiaa ?19?
translation: Without the perfect Guru, they all are infatuated by maya.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਬੰਦੇ
translation: Rare behave according to the wisdom of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਸਾਣੀ ਕਿਰਸਾਣ ਕਰਿ ਖੇਤ ਬੀਜਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਨ ਲਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Kirasaani Kirasaan Kari Khayt Beeji Soukh Phalu N Lahanday.
translation: Farmers even having done their farming donot attain the fruit of spiritual Leasure.

gurmukhi: ਵਣਜੁ ਕਰਨਿ ਵਾਪਾਰੀੲੇ ਲੈ ਲਾਹਾ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਨ ਵਸੰਦੇ
transliteration: Vanaju Karani Vaapaareeay Lai Laahaa Nij Ghari N Vasanday.
translation: The traders engaged in profitable trading donot remain stablized theirselves.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਕਰ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਚਾਕਰੀ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਮਾਰਿ ਨ ਸੁਲਹ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Chaakar Kari Kari Chaakaree Haoumai Maari N Sulah Karanday.
translation: The servants go on doing their jobs but not eschewing ego Alley donot meet the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪੁੰਨ ਦਾਨ ਚੰਗਿਅਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਤਬ ਥਿਰੁ ਨ ਰਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Pounn Daan Changiaaeeaan Kari Kari Karatab Diru N Rahanday.
translation: People, despite their virtues and charities and .even performing many duties donot remain stablized.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਜੇ ਪਰਜੇ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੈ ਕਰਿ ਕਰਿ ਵਾਦੁ ਨ ਪਾਰਿ ਪਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Raajay Parajay Hoi Kai Kari Kari Vaadu N Paari Pavanday.
translation: Becoming rulers And subjects, people undertake many quarrels but donot go across the world wean.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰੁਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਮੇਲ ਮਿਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Souni Gurousikh Hoi Saadhasangati Kari Mayl Miladay.
translation: Sikhs of the Guru, adopt teachings of the Guru, and joining the holy congregation attain that supreme Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਚਲਦੇ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਬੰਦੇ ॥੨੦॥
transliteration: Guramati Chaladay Viralay Banday ?20?
translation: Only rare ones behave in accordance with the wisdom of the Guru, the Gurmati.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਬਿਨ ਗੁਣ ਗੁਰੂ
translation: Guru without virtues

gurmukhi: ਗੁੰਗਾ ਗਾਵਿ ਨ ਜਾਣੲੀ ਬੋਲਾ ਸੁਣੈ ਨ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Goungaa Gaavi N Jaanaee Bolaa Sounai N Andari Aanai.
translation: The dumb person cannot sing and the deaf cannot hear so that nothing enters their understanding.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਨ੍ਹੈ ਦਿਸਿ ਨ ਅਾਵੲੀ ਰਾਤਿ ਅਨ੍ਹੇਰੀ ਘਰੁ ਨ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Annhai Disi N Aavaee Raati Anhayree Gharu N Siaanai.
translation: The blind cannot see and in the dark and he cannot identify the house (he lives in).

gurmukhi: ਚਲਿ ਨ ਸਕੈ ਪਿੰਗੁਲਾ ਲੂਲ੍ਹਾ ਗਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਹੇਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Chali N Sakai Pingulaa Loolhaa Gali Mili Haytu N Jaanai.
translation: A cripple cannot keep pace and a handicapped cannot embrace to show his love.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਢਿ ਸਪੁਤੀ ਨ ਥੀਅੈ ਖੁਸਰੇ ਨਾਲਿ ਨ ਰਲੀਅਾਂ ਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sanddhi Soupoutee N Deeai Khousaray Naali N Raleeaan Maanai.
translation: A barren woman cannot have a son, nor can she enjoy coition with a eunuch.

gurmukhi: ਜਣਿ ਜਣਿ ਪੁਤਾ ਮਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਲਾਡਲੇ ਨਾਂਵ ਧਰੇਨ ਧਿਙਾਣੈ
transliteration: Jani Jani Poutaan Maaeeaan Dalay Naanv Dharayni Dhiaanai.
translation: The mothers giving births to their sons give them pet names lovingly (but mere good names cannot make a good man).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਵਿਣੁ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਜੋਤਿ ਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਟਟਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gurasikhee Satiguroo Vinu Sooraju Joti N Hoi Tataanai.
translation: Sikh life without the true Guru is impossible as a glow worm cannot enlighten the sun.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਵਖਾਣੈ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Vakhaanai ?21?
translation: In the holy congretation the word of the Guru is explained (and the jiv cultivates understanding).

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਸਿੱਖੀ ਸਰਬ ਸ਼ਿਰੋਮਣੀ ਹੈ
translation: Sikh life is supreme

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਲਾੲਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਰੂਪਿ ਨ ਅਪੜਿ ਸਕੈ
transliteration: Lakh Dhiaan Samaadhi Laai Guramoukhi Roopi N Aparhi Sakai.
translation: Millions of meditational postures and concentrations cannot equal the form of the gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਵਖਾਣਿ ਕਰਿ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ੳੁਡਾਰੀ ਥਕੈ
transliteration: Lakh Giaan Vakhaani Kar Sabad Surati Udaaree Dakai.
translation: Millions got tired with learning and elaborations and with flights of consciousness to reach the divine Word.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਧਿ ਬਲ ਬਚਨ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਲਖ ਢਹਿ ਢਹਿ ਪਵਨਿ ਪਿਰਮ ਦਰਿ ਧਕੈ
transliteration: Budhi Bal Bachan Bibayk Lakh Ddhahi Ddhahi Pavani Piram Dari Dhakai.
translation: Millions of people using their intellect and powers talk of discerning wisdom but they fall and stagger, and, at the door of the Lord they get jolts and blows.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਬੈਰਾਗ ਲਖ ਸਹਿ ਨ ਸਕਹਿ ਗੁਣ ਵਾਸੁ ਮਹਕੈ
transliteration: Jog Bhog Bairaag Lakh Sahi N Sakahi Goun Vaasu Mahakai.
translation: Millions of yogis, pleasure seekers and recluses cannot bear the passions and fragrance of the three qualities of nature (sattv, rajas and tamas).

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਅਚਰਜ ਅਚਰਜ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਅਕੈ
transliteration: Lakh Acharaj Acharaj Hoi Abigati Gati Abigati Vichi Akai.
translation: Millions of wonderstruck people have got tired of the unmanifest nature of the unmanifest Lord.

gurmukhi: ਵਿਸਮਾਦੀ ਵਿਸਮਾਦੁ ਲਖ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਹਮਿ ਸਹਕੈ
transliteration: Visamaadee Visamaadu Lakh Akad Kadaa Vichi Sahami Sahakai.
translation: Millions are awe-struck, with the ineffable story of that wondrous Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖੀ ਦੈ ਅਖਿ ਫਰਕੈ ॥੨੨॥੨੮॥
transliteration: Gurasikhee Dai Akhi Dharakai ?22?28?atdaaee?
translation: They all are equal to the delight of one moment of the life of a Sikh of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧ ਮਿਲੇ ਸਸਿ ਘਰਿ ਸੂਰਿ ਪੂਰ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Gur Sikh Sandh Milay , Sasi Ghari Soori Poor Nij Ghari Aaay Hai ?
translation: The union of Guru and Sikh leads the Sikh to focus his mind on the divine word. The irha, pingla and Sukhmana enter the tenth door of the Sikh making him realise himself and granting him spiritual peace.

gurmukhi: ਓਲਟਿ ਪਵਨ ਮਨ ਮੀਨ ਤ੍ਰਿਬੈਨੀ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਗ ਤ੍ਰਿਕੁਟੀ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰ ਸਮਾੲੇ ਹੈ
transliteration: Ao?lati Pavan Man Meen Tribainee Prasanga , Trikoutee Ulanghi Soukh Saagar Samaaay Hai ?
translation: Practicing Naam Simran, the frolicsome mind becomes peaceful and crossing all hurdles gets engrossed in the realm of peace and tranquillity-the Dasam Duar. They are not to bear the torments of yogic practices.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਗੁਨ ਅਤੀਤ ਚਤੁਰਥ ਪਦ ਗੰਮਿਤਾ ਕੈ ਨਿਝਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਧਾਰ ਅਮਿਅ ਚੁਅਾੲੈ ਹੈ
transliteration: Trigoun Ateet Chaturad Pad Ganmitaa Kai , Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Amia Chuaaeai Hai ?
translation: A practitioner of Naam detaches himself from the three pronged influence of mammon i.e. the worldly attractions and reach the stage of absolute.

gurmukhi: ਚਕੲੀ ਚਕੋਰ ਮੋਰ ਚਾਤ੍ਰਿਕ ਅਨੰਦਮੲੀ ਕਦਲੀ ਕਮਲ ਬਿਮਲ ਜਲ ਛਾੲੇ ਹੈ ॥੨੮॥
transliteration: Chakaee Chakor Mor Chaatrik Anandamaee , Kadalee Kamal Bimal Jal Chhaaay Hai ?28?
translation: Just as Chakvi (Sun bird) seeing sun, Chakor (moon bird) seeing moon, rain bird and peacock seeing clouds get into wondrous stage of bliss, similarly a ·Gunnukh (Guru conscious person) who practices Naam Simran keeps progressing like a lotus flower in the
